terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.subtitle: These Terms of Service govern your use of the CredoCarbon platform for carbon credit registration, validation, verification, issuance, and trading.

acceptance.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By accessing and using the CredoCarbon platform ("Service"), you accept and agree to be bound by the terms and provisions of this agreement. If you do not agree to these Terms of Service, please do not use our Service. These Terms apply to all users, including project developers, Validation and Verification Bodies (VVBs), carbon credit buyers, and API developers.

description.title: 2. Description of Service
description.intro: CredoCarbon provides a unified platform for carbon credit lifecycle management across global registries. Our Service includes:
items: Carbon project registration and management tools
Monitoring, Reporting, and Verification (MRV) workflows and automation
Multi-registry integration (Verra, Gold Standard, GCC, Plan Vivo, ACR, CAR)
Project methodology selection and baseline calculation tools
VVB collaboration and verification management
Carbon credit issuance, transfer, and retirement tracking
API access for programmatic integration and data exchange
Analytics, reporting dashboards, and carbon credit portfolio management
Marketplace features for carbon credit trading (where applicable)

accounts.title: 3. User Accounts and Roles
accounts.intro: To access certain features of the Service, you must register for an account. Different user roles have different access levels:

roles.desc: Create and manage carbon projects, submit to registries, track credit issuance
Access project data for validation and verification, submit reports
Browse, purchase, and retire carbon credits
Access API for integration and automation

agreeItems: Provide accurate, current, and complete information during registration
Maintain the security of your password and account credentials
Notify us immediately of any unauthorized use of your account
Accept responsibility for all activities that occur under your account
Ensure you have the authority to represent your organization

projectData.title: 4. Carbon Project Data and Accuracy
projectData.intro: When using our Service to register and manage carbon projects, you represent and warrant that:
items: All project data, baseline information, and emission reduction calculations are accurate and truthful
You have the legal right to develop and register the carbon project
The project complies with all applicable registry standards and methodologies
You will not submit false or misleading information to registries
You will maintain proper documentation and evidence for all project claims
You will not engage in double counting or fraudulent carbon credit activities

acceptableUse.title: 5. Acceptable Use
acceptableUse.intro: You agree not to use the Service to:
items: Violate any applicable laws, regulations, or carbon market standards
Submit fraudulent or misleading carbon project information
Engage in double counting of carbon credits across registries
Infringe upon the intellectual property rights of others
Transmit any harmful, malicious code, or viruses
Attempt to gain unauthorized access to our systems or other users' accounts
Interfere with or disrupt the Service, servers, or networks
Use the Service for any fraudulent, illegal, or unethical purpose
Scrape, harvest, or collect user data without authorization
Reverse engineer or attempt to extract source code from our platform

registry.title: 6. Registry Integration and Submissions
registry.intro: Our Service facilitates submissions to third-party carbon registries. You acknowledge that:
items: Final approval and credit issuance decisions are made by the respective registries, not CredoCarbon
Each registry has its own terms, standards, and requirements that you must comply with
CredoCarbon is not responsible for registry decisions, delays, or rejections
Registry fees and requirements are separate from CredoCarbon service fees
You are responsible for maintaining compliance with registry standards throughout the project lifecycle

ip.title: 7. Intellectual Property
ip.content: The Service and its original content, features, and functionality are owned by CredoCarbon and are protected by international copyright, trademark, patent, trade secret, and other intellectual property laws. You retain ownership of your carbon project data, but grant us a license to use it to provide the Service.

privacy.title: 8. Data and Privacy
privacy.content: Your use of the Service is also governed by our Privacy Policy. We collect, use, and protect your data as described in our Privacy Policy, which is incorporated into these Terms by reference. You acknowledge that certain carbon project data may be shared with registries, VVBs, and made publicly available for transparency purposes.

payment.title: 9. Payment Terms
payment.intro: Certain aspects of the Service may be provided for a fee, including:
items: Subscription plans for platform access
Project registration and management fees
API usage fees based on call volume
Premium features and advanced analytics
Transaction fees for carbon credit trading (where applicable)
payment.note: You agree to pay all fees associated with your selected plan. All fees are non-refundable unless otherwise stated. We reserve the right to change our pricing with 30 days' notice. Registry submission fees are separate and paid directly to registries.

api.title: 10. API Usage and Developer Terms
api.intro: If you use our API, you additionally agree to:
items: Comply with API rate limits and usage guidelines
Properly secure and protect your API keys
Not use the API to create competing services
Attribute CredoCarbon when displaying data from our API
Comply with all applicable carbon market regulations when using API data

warranties.title: 11. Warranties and Disclaimers
warranties.intro: The Service is provided "as is" and "as available" without warranties of any kind. We do not guarantee:
items: That carbon projects will be approved by registries
Specific timelines for registry approvals or credit issuance
The accuracy of third-party data or registry information
Uninterrupted or error-free operation of the Service
That the Service will meet all your specific requirements

liability.title: 12. Limitation of Liability
liability.intro: In no event shall CredoCarbon, its directors, employees, partners, agents, suppliers, or affiliates be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, including but not limited to:
items: Loss of profits, revenue, or carbon credits
Loss of data or project information
Registry rejection or delays
Market value fluctuations of carbon credits
Business interruption or opportunity costs

indemnification.title: 13. Indemnification
indemnification.intro: You agree to indemnify and hold harmless CredoCarbon from any claims, damages, losses, or expenses arising from:
items: Your violation of these Terms
Your violation of any carbon market regulations or registry standards
Fraudulent or inaccurate carbon project data you submit
Your infringement of any third-party rights

termination.title: 14. Termination
termination.intro: We may terminate or suspend your account and access to the Service immediately, without prior notice or liability, for any reason, including breach of these Terms, fraudulent activity, or violation of carbon market regulations. Upon termination:
items: Your right to use the Service will immediately cease
You may request an export of your project data within 30 days
We may retain certain data as required by registries or legal obligations
Outstanding fees remain due and payable

governing.title: 15. Governing Law
governing.content: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with applicable laws, without regard to conflict of law provisions. Any disputes shall be resolved through binding arbitration.

changes.title: 16. Changes to Terms
changes.content: We reserve the right to modify or replace these Terms at any time. We will provide notice of any material changes by posting the new Terms on this page and, where appropriate, sending you an email notification. Your continued use of the Service after such changes constitutes acceptance of the new Terms.

contact.title: 17. Contact Information
contact.content: If you have any questions about these Terms of Service, please contact us at:

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: CredoCarbon is committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the security of your carbon project data. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and safeguard your information.

intro.title: 1. Introduction
intro.content: CredoCarbon ("we," "our," or "us") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our carbon credit platform and services for project registration, validation, verification, issuance, and trading.

collection.title: 2. Information We Collect
collection.intro: We collect information that you provide directly to us, including:

items.label: Account Information:
items.desc: Name, email address, organization name, role, phone number, and professional credentials

items.label: Carbon Project Data:
items.desc: Project details, methodology selection, baseline data, monitoring reports, emission reduction calculations, geographic information, and project documentation

items.label: Verification Data:
items.desc: VVB reports, validation documents, verification statements, and audit trails

items.label: Transaction Information:
items.desc: Carbon credit issuance records, transfer history, retirement certificates, and trading activities

items.label: Payment Information:
items.desc: Billing address, payment method details (processed securely by third-party providers)

items.label: Usage Data:
items.desc: Log data, device information, IP address, browser type, API usage patterns, and platform interactions

items.label: Communications:
items.desc: Messages, support tickets, feedback, and correspondence with our team

usage.title: 3. How We Use Your Information
usage.intro: We use the collected information for various purposes specific to carbon credit operations:
items: To provide, maintain, and improve our carbon credit platform and services
To facilitate project registration, validation, verification, and issuance processes
To process carbon credit transactions, transfers, and retirements
To integrate with carbon registries (Verra, Gold Standard, GCC, Plan Vivo, etc.)
To generate MRV (Monitoring, Reporting & Verification) reports and documentation
To send technical notices, project updates, verification status alerts, and security notifications
To respond to your comments, questions, and customer service requests
To monitor and analyze platform usage, trends, and carbon market activities
To detect, prevent, and address technical issues, fraudulent activity, and double counting
To comply with carbon registry requirements and legal obligations
To maintain audit trails for carbon credit integrity and transparency

sharing.title: 4. Data Sharing and Disclosure
sharing.intro: We may share your information in the following circumstances:

items.label: With Your Consent:
items.desc: When you explicitly agree to share information

items.label: Carbon Registries:
items.desc: Project data shared with Verra, Gold Standard, GCC, Plan Vivo, and other registries for project submission, validation, verification, and credit issuance

items.label: Validation and Verification Bodies (VVBs):
items.desc: Project information shared with accredited VVBs for independent verification

items.label: Service Providers:
items.desc: Third-party vendors who perform services on our behalf (cloud hosting, analytics, payment processing)

items.label: Public Carbon Credit Information:
items.desc: Certain carbon credit data (project details, issuance records, retirement information) may be publicly accessible for transparency and market integrity

items.label: Legal Requirements:
items.desc: When required by law, regulation, or to protect our rights and comply with carbon market regulations

items.label: Business Transfers:
items.desc: In connection with mergers, acquisitions, or asset sales

security.title: 5. Data Security
security.intro: We implement robust technical and organizational measures to protect your carbon project data:
items: AES-256 encryption for data at rest
TLS 1.3 encryption for data in transit
Regular security audits and penetration testing
SOC 2 Type II compliance
ISO 27001 certified Information Security Management System
Role-based access control (RBAC) for project data
Multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all user accounts
Immutable audit logs for carbon credit transactions
Geo-redundant backups and disaster recovery procedures

retention.title: 6. Data Retention
retention.intro: We retain your information for as long as necessary to provide our services and comply with legal obligations. Carbon project data and credit transaction records may be retained for extended periods due to:
items: Carbon registry requirements for audit trails and verification history
Regulatory compliance and carbon market integrity standards
Long-term project monitoring and permanence requirements
Legal and contractual obligations

rights.title: 7. Your Rights
rights.intro: Depending on your location, you may have the following rights regarding your personal data:
items: Access and receive a copy of your personal data
Correct inaccurate or incomplete data
Request deletion of your data (subject to carbon registry and legal retention requirements)
Object to or restrict processing of your data
Data portability for your carbon project information
Withdraw consent at any time (where processing is based on consent)
Lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority
rights.note: Note: Some carbon project data may need to be retained for registry compliance and cannot be deleted while projects are active or credits are outstanding.

cookies.title: 8. Cookies and Tracking
cookies.content: We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to collect and track information about your use of our platform. You can control cookies through your browser settings. See our Cookie Policy for more details.

international.title: 9. International Data Transfers
international.intro: Your information may be transferred to and processed in countries other than your country of residence to facilitate global carbon market operations. We ensure appropriate safeguards are in place for such transfers, including:
items: Standard contractual clauses approved by regulatory authorities
Adequacy decisions for data transfers
Compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and other applicable privacy regulations

thirdParty.title: 10. Third-Party Services
thirdParty.content: Our platform integrates with third-party services including carbon registries, payment processors, and analytics providers. These third parties have their own privacy policies governing their use of your information.

children.title: 11. Children's Privacy
children.content: Our Service is not intended for individuals under the age of 18. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children.

changes.title: 12. Changes to This Policy
changes.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in technology, legislation, carbon market regulations, or our business operations. We will notify you of any material changes by posting the new policy on this page and, where appropriate, sending you an email notification.

contact.title: 13. Contact Us
contact.content: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or wish to exercise your privacy rights, please contact us at:

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.subtitle: This Cookie Policy explains how CredoCarbon uses cookies and similar technologies to enhance your experience on our carbon credit platform.

what.title: 1. What Are Cookies?
what.content: Cookies are small text files that are placed on your device when you visit our website. They help us provide you with a better experience by remembering your preferences, maintaining your session security, and understanding how you interact with our carbon credit platform.

essential.title: Essential Cookies
essential.desc: These cookies are necessary for the platform to function properly. They enable core functionality such as secure access to your carbon project dashboard, transaction processing, and data integrity.
items: User authentication and session management
Security and fraud prevention for carbon credit transactions
Load balancing and platform stability
API access token management for developers

functional.title: Functional Cookies
functional.desc: These cookies enable enhanced functionality and personalization specific to carbon credit management.
items: Language and regional preferences
Dashboard layout and view preferences
Project type and registry filters
Notification preferences for project updates and verifications
Carbon credit portfolio display settings

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies
analytics.desc: These cookies help us understand how users interact with our platform by collecting and reporting information anonymously. This helps us improve the carbon credit registration, validation, and trading experience.
items: Page views and navigation patterns within the platform
Feature usage statistics (e.g., MRV tools, project wizard, API usage)
Performance metrics and load times
User journey analysis for platform optimization

marketing.title: Marketing Cookies
marketing.desc: These cookies track your online activity to help us deliver more relevant information about carbon credit opportunities and measure the effectiveness of our outreach campaigns.
items: Targeted content about carbon credit methodologies and registries
Campaign performance tracking for carbon market education
Retargeting for platform features and updates

thirdParty.title: 3. Third-Party Cookies
thirdParty.intro: We use services from trusted third-party providers that may set their own cookies to enhance platform functionality:

items.label: Google Analytics:
items.desc: Website analytics and performance monitoring to improve user experience

items.label: Payment Processors:
items.desc: Secure payment processing for carbon credit transactions

items.label: Support Services:
items.desc: Customer support and messaging for technical assistance

items.label: Social Media:
items.desc: Social media integration for sharing carbon project updates

duration.title: 4. Cookie Duration
duration.intro: Cookies may be either "session" or "persistent" cookies:

items.label: Session Cookies:
items.desc: Temporary cookies that expire when you close your browser. These are essential for maintaining your login session and transaction security.

items.label: Persistent Cookies:
items.desc: Remain on your device for a set period (typically 30 days to 2 years) or until you delete them. These remember your preferences and settings across sessions.

managing.title: 5. Managing Cookies
managing.intro: You have the right to decide whether to accept or reject cookies. You can exercise your cookie preferences through:

items.label: Cookie Consent Banner:
items.desc: Manage preferences when you first visit our platform

items.label: Browser Settings:
items.desc: Most browsers allow you to refuse or delete cookies through their settings

items.label: Opt-Out Tools:
items.desc: Use industry opt-out tools for advertising cookies

items.label: Account Settings:
items.desc: Manage certain cookie preferences within your CredoCarbon account dashboard

managing.important: Important: Blocking or deleting essential cookies may impact your ability to access certain features of the platform, including project management, carbon credit transactions, and API integrations.

browser.title: 6. Browser-Specific Instructions
browser.intro: To manage cookies in your browser:

items.label: Chrome:
items.desc: Settings → Privacy and security → Cookies and other site data

items.label: Firefox:
items.desc: Options → Privacy & Security → Cookies and Site Data

items.label: Safari:
items.desc: Preferences → Privacy → Cookies and website data

items.label: Edge:
items.desc: Settings → Privacy, search, and services → Cookies and site permissions

dnt.title: 7. Do Not Track
dnt.content: Some browsers include a "Do Not Track" (DNT) feature. While our platform does not currently respond to DNT signals, we are committed to respecting your privacy preferences and complying with applicable data protection regulations.

carbonData.title: 8. Cookies and Carbon Credit Data
carbonData.content: We want to assure you that cookies do not store sensitive carbon project data, financial information, or personally identifiable information beyond what is necessary for authentication and session management. All carbon credit transaction data and project information are stored securely in our encrypted databases, separate from cookie storage.

updates.title: 9. Updates to This Policy
updates.content: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in technology, legislation, or our business operations. We will notify you of any material changes through our platform or via email.

contact.title: 10. Contact Us
contact.content: If you have questions about our use of cookies or privacy practices, please contact us at:

compliance.title: Carbon Market Compliance & Certifications
compliance.subtitle: CredoCarbon maintains the highest standards of compliance across global carbon registries, regulatory frameworks, and industry best practices to ensure trust and transparency in carbon markets.

registry.title: Global Carbon Registry Compliance
registry.intro: CredoCarbon is designed to seamlessly integrate with and comply with the standards and requirements of all major international carbon credit registries:

verra.title: Verra VCS Program
verra.desc: Full compliance with Verified Carbon Standard methodology requirements, validation and verification procedures, and credit issuance protocols.

goldStandard.title: Gold Standard
goldStandard.desc: Adherence to Gold Standard for the Global Goals framework, ensuring projects deliver measurable climate and sustainable development impacts.

gcc.title: Global Carbon Council (GCC)
gcc.desc: Compliance with GCC's rigorous standards for carbon offset projects in the Middle East, Africa, and Asia.

planVivo.title: Plan Vivo
planVivo.desc: Support for Plan Vivo's community-focused approach to nature-based carbon projects and smallholder engagement.

acr.title: American Carbon Registry (ACR)
acr.desc: Alignment with ACR's standards for carbon offset projects in North America and beyond.

car.title: Climate Action Reserve (CAR)
car.desc: Compliance with CAR protocols for high-quality carbon offset projects in North America.

mrv.title: MRV (Monitoring, Reporting & Verification) Standards
mrv.intro: Our platform ensures rigorous adherence to MRV best practices across all carbon credit projects:

items.label: ISO 14064-2:
items.desc: Quantification and reporting of greenhouse gas emission reductions or removal enhancements at the project level

items.label: ISO 14064-3:
items.desc: Validation and verification of greenhouse gas assertions

items.label: Continuous Monitoring:
items.desc: Real-time data collection and automated reporting systems for enhanced transparency

items.label: Third-Party Verification:
items.desc: Integration with accredited Validation and Verification Bodies (VVBs)

items.label: Satellite & IoT Integration:
items.desc: Advanced remote sensing and IoT device data for accurate carbon accounting

article6.title: Article 6 of the Paris Agreement
article6.intro: CredoCarbon is designed to support compliance with Article 6 mechanisms for international carbon market cooperation, including:
items: Article 6.2: Cooperative approaches with corresponding adjustments
Article 6.4: Sustainable Development Mechanism for global carbon crediting
Robust accounting to avoid double counting of emission reductions

euEts.title: EU Emissions Trading System (EU ETS)
euEts.intro: Support for compliance with the world's largest carbon market, including:
items: Monitoring and reporting requirements under EU MRV Regulation
Integration with Union Registry for allowance tracking
Compliance with EU Taxonomy for sustainable activities

vcmi.title: Voluntary Carbon Market Integrity (VCMI)
vcmi.content: Alignment with VCMI's Code of Practice for high-integrity voluntary carbon market participation, ensuring credible corporate climate claims.

icvcm.title: Integrity Council for the Voluntary Carbon Market (ICVCM)
icvcm.content: Support for Core Carbon Principles (CCPs) to ensure carbon credits represent real, additional, quantified, permanent, and independently verified emission reductions or removals.

soc2.title: SOC 2 Type II
soc2.content: We maintain SOC 2 Type II compliance, demonstrating our commitment to security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy. Our controls are audited annually by independent third-party auditors.

iso27001.title: ISO 27001
iso27001.content: Our Information Security Management System (ISMS) is certified to ISO 27001 standards, ensuring systematic management of sensitive carbon project data and continuous improvement of security practices.

gdpr.title: GDPR & CCPA Compliance
gdpr.intro: Full compliance with global privacy regulations including:
items: EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)
Data subject rights and privacy by design principles
Transparent data processing and consent management

antiFraud.title: Anti-Fraud & Double Counting Prevention
antiFraud.intro: CredoCarbon implements robust mechanisms to prevent fraud and ensure carbon credit integrity:
items: Unique serial number tracking for every carbon credit
Cross-registry verification to prevent double issuance
Automated retirement and cancellation protocols
Real-time monitoring for suspicious activities
Integration with registry databases for credit status verification

continuous.title: Continuous Compliance Monitoring
continuous.intro: We maintain a proactive approach to compliance:
items: Regular internal and external audits
Continuous monitoring of regulatory changes across jurisdictions
Quarterly compliance reviews and updates
Employee training on carbon market regulations and best practices
Engagement with industry working groups and standard-setting bodies

contact.title: Contact Our Compliance Team
contact.content: For questions about our compliance program, to request audit reports, or to report security concerns:
